article.title: Northrop Grumman Wins Army Integrated Battle Command System Contract
article.author: Henry Kenyon
article.text: The U.S. Army has selected Northrop Grumman to develop the Integrated Air and Missile Defense Battle Command System (IBCS) under a $577 million, five-year contract for system design and development. IBCS is an integrated air and missile defense command and control capability enabled by a battlefield fire control network that will provide warfighters with improved decision making tools.
